intro: Convolvulus gracilis, commonly known as slender morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or purple, which bloom in the morning. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Convolvulus gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
